intro: Anguina tamnifolia, commonly known as the Indian nettle or velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Violaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, pale purple flowers. The plant has a creeping growth habit and often forms dense mats, making it a common weed in agricultural fields. Its leaves are hairy and can cause skin irritation upon contact, while its seeds are dispersed by wind. Anguina tamnifolia is also known for its ability to thrive in disturbed soils and shaded environments.
